funcs.name: fb_serialize
funcs.desc: Seriailize data into a compact format that can be unserialized by fb_unserialize().

args.name: thing
args.desc: What to serialize. Note that objects are not supported.

funcs.name: fb_unserialize
funcs.desc: Unserialize a previously fb_thrift_serialize()-ed data.

args.name: thing
args.desc: What to unserialize.

args.name: success
args.desc: Whether it was successful or not.

funcs.name: fb_compact_serialize
funcs.desc: Serialize data into a compact format that can be unserialized by fb_compact_unserialize(). In general produces smaller output compared to fb_serialize(). Largest savings are on arrays with sequential (or almost sequential) indexes, i.e. simple arrays like array($a, $b, $c). NOTE: unlike serialize(), does not preserve internal references, i.e. array(&$a, &$a) will become array($a, $a).

args.name: thing
args.desc: What to serialize. Note that objects are not supported.

funcs.name: fb_compact_unserialize
funcs.desc: Unserialize a previously fb_compact_serialize()-ed data.

args.name: thing
args.desc: What to unserialize.

args.name: success
args.desc: Whether it was successful or not.

args.name: errcode
args.desc: One of those FB_UNSERIALIZE_ constants to describe what the decoding error was, if it failed.

funcs.name: fb_could_include
funcs.desc: Returns whether the (php) file could be included (eg if its been compiled into the binary)

return.desc: TRUE if it could be included

args.name: file
args.desc: The file to test

funcs.name: fb_intercept
funcs.desc: Invokes a user handler upon calling a function or a class method. If this handler returns FALSE, code will continue with original function. Otherwise, it will return what handler tells. The handler function looks like "intercept_handler($name, $obj, $params, $data, &$done)", where $name is orginal function's name, $obj is $this for an instance method call or null for static method call or function calls, and $params are original call's parameters. $data is what's passed to fb_intercept() and set $done to false to indicate function should continue its execution with old function as if interception did not happen. By default $done is true so it will return handler's return immediately without executing old function's code. Note that built-in functions are not interceptable.

args.name: name
args.desc: The function or class method name to intercept. Use "class::method" for method name. If empty, all functions will be intercepted by the specified handler and registered individual handlers will be replaced. To make sure individual handlers not affected by such a call, call fb_intercept() with individual names afterwards.

args.name: handler
args.desc: Callback to handle the interception. Use null, false or empty string to unregister a previously registered handler. If name is empty, all previously registered handlers, including those that are set by individual function names, will be removed.

args.name: data
args.desc: Extra data to pass to the handler when intercepting

funcs.name: fb_rename_function
funcs.desc:
Rename a function, so that a function can be called with the new name.

When writing unit tests, one may want to stub out a function. To do so, call fb_rename_function('func_to_stub_out', 'somename') then fb_rename_function('new_func_to_replace_with', 'func_to_stub_out'). This way, when calling func_to_stub_out(), it will actually execute new_func_to_replace_with().

args.name: orig_func_name
args.desc: Which function to rename.

args.name: new_func_name
args.desc: What is the new name.

funcs.name: fb_autoload_map
funcs.desc: Specify a map containing an array with four optional elements. 'class', 'function', 'constant', and 'failure'. The first three entries are maps from names to the file where that entity is defined. An attempt to access an undefined class/function/constant will look it up in the appropriate map, and if found, include that file. If the entity is still not defined, it will call the 'failure' entry.

args.name: map
args.desc: The autoload map.

args.name: root
args.desc: Root to be prepended to all paths in the map.

funcs.name: fb_utf8ize
funcs.desc: Sanitize a string to make sure it's legal UTF-8 by stripping off any characters that are not properly encoded.

args.name: input
args.desc: What string to sanitize.

funcs.name: fb_utf8_strlen_deprecated
funcs.desc: Count the number of UTF-8 code points in string or byte count if it's not valid UTF-8.

return.desc: Returns the count of code points if valid UTF-8 else byte count.

args.name: input
args.desc: The string.

funcs.name: fb_utf8_strlen
funcs.desc: Count the number of UTF-8 code points in string, substituting U+FFFD for invalid sequences.

return.desc: Returns the number of code points interpreting string as UTF-8.

args.name: input
args.desc: The string.

funcs.name: fb_utf8_substr
funcs.desc: Cuts a portion of str specified by the start and length parameters.

return.desc:
Returns the portion of str specified by the start and length parameters.

If str is shorter than start characters long, FALSE will be returned.

args.name: str
args.desc: The original string.

args.name: start
args.desc:
If start is non-negative, fb_utf8_substr() cuts the portion out of str beginning at start'th character, counting from zero.

If start is negative, fb_utf8_substr() cuts out the portion beginning at the position, start characters away from the end of str.

args.name: length
args.desc:
If length is given and is positive, the return value will contain at most length characters of the portion that begins at start (depending on the length of string).

If negative length is passed, fb_utf8_substr() cuts the portion out of str from the start'th character up to the character that is length characters away from the end of the string. In case start is also negative, the start position is calculated beforehand according to the rule explained above.

funcs.name: fb_call_user_func_safe
funcs.desc: This function invokes $function with the arguments specified in its parameter list. It returns an array of two elements, the first being a boolean specifying whether or not the function was invoked, the latter being the return value, or null if it was not invoked. The function may be any PHP callable, either a string function name, an array of object instance and method, or array of classname and static class method.

return.desc: Two elements, 0 is a bool whether function was invoked, 1 is the return value if invoked.

args.name: function
args.desc: The callback to invoke.

funcs.name: fb_call_user_func_safe_return
funcs.desc:
This function invokes $function with the arguments specified in its parameter
list. If the function is not defined, $default_rval is returned. Note that
the default return value comes BEFORE the arguments to the function.

return.desc: The result of the function call if defined, otherwise default.

args.name: function
args.desc: The callback to invoke.

args.name: def
args.desc: Value returned when function does not exist.

funcs.name: fb_call_user_func_array_safe
funcs.desc: This function invokes $function with the arguments specified in its parameter list. It returns an array of two elements, the first being a boolean specifying whether or not the function was invoked, the latter being the return value, or null if it was not invoked. The function may be any PHP callable, either a string function name, an array of object instance and method, or array of classname and static class method.

return.desc: Two elements, 0 is a bool whether function was invoked, 1 is the return value if invoked.

args.name: function
args.desc: The callback to invoke.

args.name: params
args.desc: The function parameters to invoke with.

funcs.name: fb_get_code_coverage
funcs.desc: Returns code coverage data collected so far. Turn on code coverage by Eval.RecordCodeCoverage or by using fb_enable_code_coverage and call this function periodically to get results. Eval.CodeCoverageOutputFile allows you to specify an output file to store results at end of a script run from command line. Use this function in server mode to collect results instead.

args.name: flush
args.desc: Whether to clear data after this function call.

funcs.name: fb_enable_code_coverage
funcs.desc: Enables code coverage. The coverage information is cleared.

funcs.name: fb_disable_code_coverage
funcs.desc: Disables and returns code coverage. The coverage information is cleared.

funcs.name: xhprof_enable
funcs.desc: Starts xhprof profiling. For details on how to use this function, please refer to http://mirror.facebook.net/facebook/xhprof/doc.html.

args.name: flags
args.desc: One of those XHPROF_FLAGS_ constant to specify what to profile.

args.name: args
args.desc: Extra argument to reserve for future use.

funcs.name: xhprof_disable
funcs.desc: Ends and reports xhprof profiling result. For details on how to use this function, please refer to http://mirror.facebook.net/facebook/xhprof/doc.html.

funcs.name: xhprof_network_enable
funcs.desc: Starts xhprof network I/O profiling.

funcs.name: xhprof_network_disable
funcs.desc: Ends and reports xhprof network I/O profiling result.

funcs.name: xhprof_frame_begin
funcs.desc: Starts an artificial frame. Together with xhprof_frame_end(), this times one block of code execution as if it were a function call, allowing people to define arbitrary function boundaries. Prefer to use XhprofFrame classobjects instead of calling this function directly.

args.name: name
args.desc: The "virtual" function's name.

funcs.name: xhprof_frame_end
funcs.desc: Ends an artificial frame that xhprof_frame_begin() started. One has to make sure there are no exceptions in between these two calls, as otherwise, it may report incorrect timings. Also, xhprof_frame_begin() and xhprof_frame_end() have to be paired up really well, so not to interfere with regular function's profiling, unless that's the intention. Prefer to use XhprofFrame classobjects instead of calling this function directly.

funcs.name: xhprof_sample_enable
funcs.desc: Starts sampling based xhprof profiling. For details on how to use this function, please refer to http://mirror.facebook.net/facebook/xhprof/doc.html.

funcs.name: xhprof_sample_disable
funcs.desc: Ends sampling based xhprof profiling. For details on how to use this function, please refer to http://mirror.facebook.net/facebook/xhprof/doc.html.

funcs.name: fb_parallel_query
funcs.desc: Runs MySQL queries in parallel. Internally it will spawn threads, each of which executes one or more queries sequentially.

return.desc: Query result in a format of array('affected' => {number of affected rows}, 'result' => array({dbId1} => {dataset}, {dbId2} => ...), 'error' => array({dbId1} => {error message}, {dbId2} => ....), 'errno' => array({dbId1} => {error code}, {dbId2} => ....)).

args.name: sql_map
args.desc: The map to locate databases to query. The format is array($id1 => array('sql' => { SQL query to execute}, 'ip' => {ip address}, 'db' => {database name}, 'port' => {port number}, 'username' => {user name for login}, 'password' => {password for login}), $id2 => ...), where $id1 and $ids2 are arbitrary 32-bit integers that fb_crossall_query() can use to refer to the physical databases.

args.name: max_thread
args.desc: Maximum number of threads to run.

args.name: combine_result
args.desc: Whether to merge dataset into just one, without maps of database IDs. If TRUE, result set would be array(..., 'result' => {dataset}, ...) directly.

args.name: retry_query_on_fail
args.desc: Whether or not retry query once when it fails. This may be useful if database connection is temporarily lost during queries and re-executing a SELECT or other idempotent queries are acceptable.

args.name: connect_timeout
args.desc: Connection timeout. If timeout_in_ms is TRUE, it is in seconds. Otherwise, it is in milli-seconds.

args.name: read_timeout
args.desc: Query timeout. If timeout_in_ms is TRUE, it is in seconds. Otherwise, it is in milli-seconds.

args.name: timeout_in_ms
args.desc: Whether connect_timeout or read_timeout are in seconds or milli-seconds.

funcs.name: fb_const_fetch
funcs.desc: Fetches a constant string from a special store that's compiled into the executable. This is faster than apc_fetch(), which needs locking between different threads. This store is immutable and loaded once with strings that are never changed. Therefore, no locking is needed when accessed by different threads.

args.name: key
args.desc: The key for locating the value.

funcs.name: fb_output_compression
funcs.desc: Toggles the compression status of HipHop output, if headers have already been sent this may be ignored.

args.name: new_value
args.desc: The new value for the compression state.

funcs.name: fb_set_exit_callback
funcs.desc: Set a callback function that is called when php tries to exit.

args.name: function
args.desc: The callback to invoke. An exception object will be passed to the function

funcs.name: fb_get_last_flush_size
funcs.desc: Get stats on flushing the last data chunk from server.

return.desc: Total number of bytes flushed since last flush

funcs.name: fb_lazy_lstat
funcs.desc: Gathers the statistics of the file named by filename, like lstat(), except uses cached information from an internal inotify-based mechanism that may not be updated during the duration of a request.

return.desc: Same format as the normal php lstat() function.

args.name: filename
args.desc: Path to a file or a symbolic link.

funcs.name: fb_lazy_realpath
funcs.desc: Returns a canonicalized version of the input path that contains no symbolic links, like realpath(), except uses cached information from an internal inotify-based mechanism that may not be updated during the duration of a request.

args.name: filename
args.desc: Fake path to the file.

funcs.name: fb_setprofile
funcs.desc: Set a callback function to be called whenever a function is entered or exited. Takes 3 args, the function name, the mode (enter or exit), and an array describing the frame.

args.name: callback
args.desc: Profiler function to call or null to disable
